author: The Hawk Editor
content: BJP women leaders, including Agnimitra Paul and Locket Chatterjee, were detained by West Bengal Police in New Town, Kolkata, preventing their visit to Sandeshkhali. They protested the move, alleging TMC and police are concealing Sandeshkhali's unrest. The altercation highlighted ongoing political tensions in the region.
title: BJP women leaders detained en route to Sandeshkhali

author: ReferSMS Partner
content: President Droupadi Murmu addresses Central Sanskrit University's inaugural convocation, emphasizing Sanskrit's cultural significance and unity. She lauds its role in women's empowerment and moral education, urging students to uphold values and fulfill their potential. Her speech highlights Sanskrit's enduring relevance in shaping India's cultural identity and societal cohesion.
title: The President graced the first convocation of the University

author: Nidhi Sinha
content: After becoming Uttar Pradesh minister, Om Prakash Rajbhar told people to consider him dacoit Gabbar Singh from 'Sholay' movie. "If you've any problem, go to any police station...Tell the inspector that I've sent you. Inspector has no power to question me about it," he added. He claimed he's the most powerful person in UP after CM Yogi Adityanath.
title: Consider me Gabbar, police has no power to question me: New UP minister Rajbhar

author: Pankaj
content: Amid the conflict between Meiteis and Kukis in Manipur that has claimed at least 200 lives, a video clip showing a group of heavily armed men, purportedly Kuki militants, threatening to attack Imphal, within a week is going viral. However, the video is old and it shows Myanmar's Karenni forces threatening the country's military & police force.
title: Truth Behind Video Claiming To Show Kukis Threatening Attack

author: ReferSMS Partner
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi shares a heartfelt selfie moment with entrepreneur Nazim from Pulwama, Jammu & Kashmir, during the Viksit Bharat Viksit Jammu Kashmir program. The gesture underscores Modi's appreciation for grassroots entrepreneurship and his commitment to fostering economic growth in the region.
title: PM Modi’s Selfie Moment with Pulwama Entrepreneur Nazim

author: Nakul Ahuja
content: Union Minister Smriti Irani has reacted to reports suggesting Congress' Rahul Gandhi will contest from two seats in the Lok Sabha polls. "Why are people who say that Amethi is the Gandhi family's bastion taking...time to announce a candidate?" she asked. "If he's contesting on two seats, it means...he's announcing his loss from Amethi even before elections," she stated.
title: Rahul stating Amethi defeat before polls: Irani on 2 seats reports

author: Nidhi Sinha
content: AAP MLA Somnath Bharti said his BJP rival from New Delhi, Bansuri Swaraj, was fugitive businessman Lalit Modi's lawyer. Bharti added, "Who helped him in running away?...Her name is Bansuri Swaraj. Lalit Modi thanked Swaraj on X (Twitter)." "Did BJP ask...Swaraj to help Lalit?" Bharti asked. Calling the claims "baseless", BJP's Praveen Kapoor called Bharti a person with "misogynistic mentality".
title: Who helped Lalit Modi escape India? Bansuri Swaraj: AAP rival

author: ReferSMS Partner
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurates development projects in Jammu & Kashmir, emphasizing agriculture, tourism, and entrepreneurship. Interacting with local beneficiaries, he applauds their success stories, promising continued government support. Modi pledges to prioritize the region's growth, affirming its integral role in India's development narrative.
title: PM Modi launches major development initiative in Jammu and Kashmir

author: ReferSMS Partner
content: Raksha Mantri Rajnath Singh, at a Defence Summit, highlights India's fortified defence apparatus under PM Narendra Modi's leadership. Singh emphasizes self-reliance in defence manufacturing and strides in technological innovation. He underscores shedding the colonial mindset and revitalizing pride in India's heritage, aiming to make India a technology creator.
title: Raksha Mantri Rajnath Singh highlights India’s defence progress

author: The Hawk Editor
content: At Republic TV Summit 2024, Amit Shah praised Modi's governance, predicting another decade under Modi due to performance-based politics. He criticized opposition and stressed on no-corruption, development goals, CAA implementation, and UCC as BJP's commitment. Shah targeted West Bengal's government for corruption and appeasement, aiming to transform Bengal and India.
title: Shah: Modi will lead next decade with performance focus politics
